thread.title: Man Utd fans rage at Jose Mourinho as Henrikh Mkhitaryan risk backfires massively vs St Etienne | Metro News
thread.title_full: Man Utd fans rage at Jose Mourinho as Henrikh Mkhitaryan risk backfires massively vs St Etienne | Metro News

author: Metro Sport Reporter For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Man Utd fans rage at Jose Mourinho as Henrikh Mkhitaryan risk backfires massively vs St Etienne | Metro News

organizations.name: st etienne | metro news metro sport reporter for metro.co.uk

text:
Metro Sport Reporter for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 5:40 pm Henrikh Mkhitaryan was forced off with a suspected hamstring injury (Picture: Getty) 
Manchester United fans fumed at Jose Mourinho for risking Henrikh Mkhitaryan ahead of the EFL Cup final after the midfielder was forced off with a suspected hamstring injury against St Etienne in the Europa League. 
The Armenian was selected in a strong XI in France and the 27-year-old actually gave the Red Devils the lead after 15 minutes when he converted Juan Mata’s cross. 
However, less than ten minutes later he left the field with a suspected hamstring injury that he sustained stretching for the Spaniard’s pass. 
United had a three-goal lead going into the clash and Mourinho was expected to make changes ahead of Sunday’s EFL Cup final with Southampton. 
However, Mkhitaryan now looks likely to miss that game and United fans were raging with Mourinho for risking the Armenian. LOL, Mourinho can thank himself for that injurie to Mkhitaryan. WHY start all the best when you have a 3-0 lead ffs 
— Ronny S (@RonnyS0L) February 22, 2017 Mkhitaryan injury means it's gonna be a Lingard masterclass at Wembley. Not this again..
